    • getDegreesBetween

      public double getDegreesBetween(Location center, Location loc1, Location loc2)
      Calculates the difference between the angles of 2 vectors. The return value is the concave angle between the 2 vectors (i.e. 30 instead of 330). Vector 1: start to loc1 Vector 2: start to loc2
      Parameters:
      center - the start point for both vectors
      loc1 - the end point for vector1
      loc2 - the end point for vector2
      Returns:
      the angle to go from vector1 to vector2

    • getDegreesBetween

      public double getDegreesBetween(Match center, Match match1, Match match2)

    • getDegreesBetween

      public double getDegreesBetween(double angle1, double angle2)

    • convertAnglesToSameScale

      public List<Double> convertAnglesToSameScale(List<Double> angles)
      On a circular scale there must be a jump from one value to another. The normal scale has this break at 180/-179 degrees. This function assumes that the parameter values are clustered in one region, and makes sure that these values do not include a break.
      Parameters:
      angles - the values to convert
      Returns:
      a list of values without a break

    • getOppositeAngle

      public double getOppositeAngle(double angle)

    • getMedianAngle

      public double getMedianAngle(Location startLocation, List<Location> locations)
      Sums the x and y points and calculates the angle to this new summed Location
      Parameters:
      startLocation - the start point
      locations - the locations
      Returns:
      the median angle to all locations from the start point

    • getMedianAngle

      public double getMedianAngle(Location startLocation, Location... locations)

    • getStandardLocation

      public Location getStandardLocation(double angle)
      Returns a Location based on the starting point of (0,0) and a distance of 1000.
      Parameters:
      angle - The angle of the desired Location.
      Returns:
      a standard Location.

    • getLocation

      public Location getLocation(double angle, double distance, Location startingLocation)
      Returns a Location given a starting point, an angle, and a distance. The returned Location is not the exact location since it must be converted to (int,int) for pixel space.
      Parameters:
      angle - angle of the desired Location
      distance - distance from the starting Location to the desired Location
      startingLocation - the starting point
      Returns:
      a new Location that approximates the desired location in pixel space.

    • getLocation

      public Location getLocation(Location location1, Location location2)
      Returns the distance from location1 to location2 as a Location object.
      Parameters:
      location1 - start location
      location2 - end location
      Returns:
      a Location representing the vector from location1 to location2

    • undueConversion

      public List<Double> undueConversion(List<Double> angles)

    • undueConversion

      public double undueConversion(double a)

    • getLeftmostAngle

      public double getLeftmostAngle(List<Double> angles)
      Returns the leftmost angle from a list of angles. The leftmost angle is defined as the angle bordering on the largest gap in the angle list when moving counterclockwise.
      Parameters:
      angles - a list of angles
      Returns:
      the leftmost angle

    • getRightmostAngle

      public double getRightmostAngle(List<Double> angles)
